title: Third annual Letters Festival to take place in Atlanta in...
text:
The third annual Letters Festival will take place Nov. 12 through Nov. 14, featuring live readings, a series of craft workshops and dialogues with independent writers from around the country.
The Letters Festival, presented by Lostintheletters , an Atlanta based literary organization, and in partnership with Atlanta Contemporary, is designed to present cutting-edge, divorce voices and styles.
Readings will feature several writers including poetry by Khadijah Queen of Denver, non-fiction by Ada Calhoun of New York and fiction writing by Nikki Igbo of Atlanta. Other highlights from the literary event includes after-party readings and free access to a book Market that will feature a curated collection of presses, publishers and literary journals including Black Ocean, Big Lucks and Calamari Archive. There will also be a discussion panel, entitled “Maintaining Your Writing Practice While Building a Literary Community.”
Logo for the Letters Festival Some events are free; others cost $12 for a reading; $30 for three-day passes. Lower prices are available online .
High school and college students however, can attend all of the programs for free.
For more information and schedule of the events, go to http://www.lostintheletters.org/letters-festival-tickets/ .
Details on the event:
WHAT: The Letters Festival, a three-day literary happening with readings, workshops, panels and book
market
WHEN: November 12, 13 and 14
WHERE: Atlanta Contemporary, 535 Means Street, Atlanta
COST: Range in prices. Some events are free; others cost $12 for a reading; $30 for three-day passes. Lower prices are available online . Note: high school and college students with a valid school ID receive free admission to all programs.
